greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerators of positive rationals < 1 arranged by increasing sum of numerator and denominator then by increasing numerator.
comment: A023022(n) and A245677(n) give number and numerator of sum of fractions a(k)/A182973(k) such that a(k)+A182973(k) = n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 30 2014
reference: S. Cook, Problem 511: An Enumeration Problem, Journal of Recreational Mathematics, Vol. 9:2 (1976-77), 137. Solution by the Problem Editor, JRM, Vol. 10:2 (1977-78), 122-123.
R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory (UPINT), Section D11.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Paul Yiu, Recreational Mathematics, 24.3.1 Appendix: Two enumerations of the rational numbers in (0,1), page 633.
example: Positive fractions < 1 listed by increasing sum of numerator and denominator, and by increasing numerator for equal sums:
maple: for i from 2 to floor((n-1)/2) do
if gcd(i,n-i)=1 then t1:=[op(t1),i/(n-i)]; fi; od:
mathematica: t1={}; For[n=2, n <= 40, n++, AppendTo[t1, 1/(n-1)]; For[i=2, i <= Floor[(n-1)/2], i++, If[GCD[i, n-i] == 1, AppendTo[t1, i/(n-i)]]]]; t1 // Numerator // Rest (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 20 2015, translated from Maple *)
program: if i>j then i:=i mod j else j:=j mod i;
if i=0 then gcd:=j else gcd:=i;
a182972_list = map fst $ concatMap q [3..] where
q x = [(num, den) | num <- [1 .. div x 2],
let den = x - num, gcd num den == 1]
results.author: _William Rex Marshall_, Dec 16 2010
